inn1.comm: gets some away swing straightaway as Dimuth pushes at this away through gully to get a single to get Sri Lanka underway

straight away into the thick of things as this one jags back from a back of a length on off, with Dilshan trying to cut this away late, but instead almost ends up getting cut up himself as he almost pokes at the ball as it past through him to the keeper
this time onto the pads as Dilshan is able to get this away to the leg side
well down the leg side now as Ronchi collects it with a dive to his left
sound of bat hitting the pad as Dilshan fails to glance this behind square. Called wide by the umpire
this time delivers a length ball just outside off which curls in as Dilshan defends on the front foot
fantastic ball to end the over as this one holds its line as it slants across Dilshan, who has his bat out to it, but doesn't offer the edge
a tad reckless outside his off stump as he looks for the slice over the slips, with the line not at all conducive to the stroke
137 kph, doesn't get the line right on this one as Dimuth cuts this away through backward point, with the fielder getting a grasp on it to take most off the pace from the ball
138 kph, honing onto the pads this time as Dilshan turns this away to the leg side
137 kph, gets solidly behind the line of this length ball coming into him
137 kph, nice and tall as he shifted his weight onto the back foot to defend
132 kph, a touch shorter on the same line as this is defended away to the off side with a nice, high elbow
137 kph, drifting down the leg side as Dilshan is late on it, getting struck on the front pad. Milne goes for the shout but the umpire felt the angle didn't help
138 kph, straying on the pads as this is clipped away for an easy two through deep midwicket
140 kph, defends away this length ball outside his off stump to the midwicket fielder
138 kph, has a flash at this short, wide delivery outside off, but is late on it. Doesn't prevent the umpire, however, from signalling wide
141 kph, defended off the back foot through to the cover fielders
143 kph, rushes Dimuth with this shorter one going down the leg side as he just about manages to get him away with an amateur-looking hook through backward square
140 kph, fuller one on leg which Dilshan fails to clip behind square as the ball hits the outside of the pad

141 kph, too much width outside off as Dilshan is able to free his arms to scythe this away through the covers. Looked to want three, but decides against it after the powerful throw from deep extra-cover
136 kph, has a wild slog as this short of a length going across him, with the intention of clearing cow corner

144 kph, too fast and on target from Milne as Dimuth looks plumb in front to this fuller one swinging back into him from middle. Milne goes up for the appeal and the umpire acquiesces, but Dimuth, after a brief consultation, decides to go for the review. Pitches in line and it is an on-field call for the wicket being hit so it looks like this will remain out. Off goes Dimuth after his short tenure at the crease
139 kph, pushed across him at good pace just outside off
143 kph, full again, this time a touch closer to the batsman as Sangakkara employs his front foot defence
141 kph, length ball which slants across the left-hander as the keeper collects from behind
133 kph, gets good bounce off the deck as he slips in a bouncer along the same line which Sangakkara follows but keeps a safe distance from as it rushes through
137 kph, pops in a length ball just outside off which Dilshan allows through
139 kph, gets some inswing to this fuller one on middle and leg as Dilshan is able to get this away through midwicket for one
139 kph, swinging delivery going away as this is pitched outside off
141 kph, feeds him a fuller one just outside off to try and entice a Sanga trademark cover drive. Sensibly punched away, and in control, by the experienced left-hander
137 kph, gets a good stride in to this similar length ball as this time he tucks it away through the leg side
140 kph, full delivery on middle and leg which is fended away by the batsman
142 kph, length on middle and leg which is tucked away through midwicket for a single
144 kph, touching 90 mph here as this is solidly defended with a full face towards long off
146 kph, chases after this slightly wide, and full, delivery outside off stump as he fails to get the bat down in the nick of time to slice it away
143 kph, meets this fuller one just outside off with the full face of the bat
133 kph, uses the bouncer this time up as Sangakkara gets under it in a flash

141 kph, wide half-volley which is given the treatment as Sangakkara waits and waits before leaning into a nice, crisp drive through extra-cover to find the rope. The timing was exquisite as it raced across the truf
139 kph, another beauty as just back of a length, and going across, as Dlishan is cramped for room
140 kph, this time defended away off the back foot to the leg side
140 kph, half-volley in the slot which should have been been given the beans, but instead ends up being pushed to the fielder at mid off
137 kph, gets nicely forward before steering this with soft hands to the off side
140 kph, gets high on his toes as he looks to cut this shorter one, outside off, away behind square, but finds backward point in no time
139 kph, gets the line wrong as this is slipped onto the pads, with Dilshan slightly late on it as he looked to tuck it away through backward square

140 kph, short of a length and going across as Sangakkara plays with sot hands to the off side, looking for the quick single, but is sent back after an excellent scramble at silly mid off to stop this and throw it back to the keeper

146 kph, you just can't have a NZ match without a screamer at backward point. This time it is Williamson's turn who continues his wonderful form as he takes a good, low catch to his right to snag a huge wicket for NZ. Milne bowled one on a fuller length which Sangakkara couldn't help but go after as he offers a slice to Williamson, who pulls it off with ease.
138 kph, length outside off which is allowed to carry through to the keeper
141 kph, bang on middle stump and full at that as Mahela gets away with a squirted single through point
143 kph, straying onto the pads as Dilshan mistimes this away through midwicket. Hasn't quite got into top gear here at Christchurch
142 kph, gets some late away swing to this length ball on middle and off as Mahela gets right behind it
139 kph, Dilshan opens up the shoulders to club this fuller length going across him through backward square for a boundary
136 kph, looks to follow up the wide delivery outside off with a bumper on leg, but doesn't get the line right as this splays down leg to the keeper
137 kph, better this time from Boult as Dilshan is cramped for room as he runs this to gully
136 kph, length on the pads which is tucked away softly to the leg side
136 kph, didn't seem to do much of a difference though as Dilshan plants his foot to have another wild swipe through the covers, but is late on it
140 kph, full and on the pads as Dilshan eases this to deep backward square for a single
139 kph, pushes through a fuller length ball outside off to end the over
142 kph, strikes Dilshan on the pad, but this one going down the leg side
144 kph, unleashes a thunderbolt just outside off as Dilshan drives at this on the up, but straight to the man at mid off
138 kph, slips in a shorter length which Dilshan is right on top of as he executes the pull through midwicket with a flourish as the left leg swivels out
143 kph, fuller this time from Milne, just outside off, as Dilshan finds the man at mid off again
138 kph, almost rushes him into an inside-edge onto the stumps as this one is hit into the stomach
144 kph, looks to drive once more on the up, this time through long off, but no dice
130 kph, starts with a length ball going across him outside off which is parried away to backward point
136 kph, sound of the bat hitting pad as this one goes down the leg side, with Mahela looking to have a tickle, but not able to get any connection
136 kph, uncorks a trademark Mahela drive through cover, but the fielder is able to take out most of the sting
133 kph, safely negotiates this back of a length slanting across him outside his off stump

136 kph, clever batting this from Mahela as he shows his experience in ramping this short ball over the keeper and slips. The third man fielder was also placed quite wide so that worked in the favour of the batsman
140 kph, back-to-back boundaries from Mahela now as he leans into a drive, this time through extra-cover, to find the boundary rope
129 kph, begins with a length ball on the pads, and curling in, as Dilshan is late on this
135 kph, glanced away through backward square for a single
134 kph, looks to blast this one away through extra-cover, but finds the fielder
134 kph, pushes through a length ball outside his off stump which is allowed to carry to Ronchi
134 kph, another good length delivery, this time closer to the body, as Mahela elects to leave
135 kph, shifts the line a little bit more outside off as Mahela can't be coaxed to have a go
shorter one on middle which is attacked with gusto through midwicket for one

gets nicely on top of this shorter one from Mitchell as Mahela rocks back to try and play this with soft hands to the leg side, with Dilshan wanting the single at the other end. They end up running it as Mitchell is wise to it, with Dilshan at the last moment sending back his partner when he is alerted to the danger, but by that point it is too late. Looks like Mahela is out, but replays confirm that when Mitchell broke the stumps, he had bobbled the ball just before, so it ends up not counting. Huge let-off for Sri Lanka as New Zealand would have badly wanted that wicket
just back of a length and going across him. Played away to the off side
slips in a bouncer down the leg side which is immediately wided by the umpire
another back of a length ball outside Mahela's off stump which is allowed to sail through to the keeper
offers width outside off as Mahela pinpoints the gap through backward point with precision, cutting this away powerfully to find the boundary
this time worked away off the back foot to the leg side to retain the strike
length just outside off and fended away towards the general direction of mid off
gentle length ball outside off and curling in as Mahela shows good awareness of his off stump

short of a length outside off as Mahela utilises the angle to ramp this through the vacant slip region, but Mitchell, coming fast from a widish, third man position is able to put in the big dive and cut this off from the boundary as the force of his momentum pushes the ball directly ahead and away from any danger. This NZ team really are a superb fielding outfit
delivers one well wide down the leg side
slaps hard at this back of a length which cramps him for space

wonderful sound of the bat as this length ball going across Dilshan is cover driven on the up with vigour by Dilshan, with all the fielders rooted in the spot as this one was sent haring back through extra-cover
this time finds the gap at midwicket to keep the strike
and he begins with a slider going across Dilshan as he had a lazy waft at it
this time drives this one darted in on middle and off through to the off side

bamboozles Dilshan, who looks to be in a hurry to get somewhere, with a beautiful flighted delivery pitched outside off which invites Dilshan to come down the track as he looked for the heave over cover, but is late on the ball as he enters his downswing, with Ronchi doing well to collect this cleanly and then remove the bails in a flash as Dilshan swiveled around to take stock of the situation
floats in one just outside off and turning in as Mathews tucks this away to the leg side
tries him on middle this time as Mathews directs this back to the bowler
ends the wicket maiden with a flighted delivery just outside off which is handled efficiently by the batsman
141 kph, fuller length on middle and off which is whisked away to backward square
142 kph, looking for the yorker as this fuller one just outside off is negotiated safely
147 kph, fires in another full one targeting the off stump as this is guided by Mathews to mid off
145 kph, looks like he has been sent in by Baz to stir things up with his pace. This time delivers a length ball just outside off which is met with the full face
138 kph, another full one, this time on middle and leg, as Mathews is able to get behind it
141 kph, slips in another fuller one, this time closer to off, as Mathews is late on it as he looks to drive at it
flighted on middle and steered away to the leg side by Mahela
this time on a fuller length as this is eased down to long on
holds up in the air somewhat as this is chipped softly to the leg side
steered away with firm hands through the off side
onto the back foot as he finds the gap through backward square to pinch the single
dead-bats this quicker one darted in from around the wicket
144 kph, short of a length, outside off, which is bunted away off the back foot
147 kph, gets an inside-edge to this fuller one outside off which fortunately travels in front of square and not behind to find the stumps
148 kph, delivers the fastest ball of the match thus far on the pads as Mathews clips this away with aplomb to find the boundary at midwicket
fantastic response this from Milne, as this one is delivered outside off at a length as Mathews plays inside of the line
131 kph, short and wide and Mathews is able to cut this away through deep-extra cover with a hard slap
manages to prise out a single through the leg side to retain strike
darts in a quicker one across him which is defended to the off side
defended with a nice, straight bat back to the bowler
manages to get a single away through the leg side
uses the slow pace to cut this away outside his off stump through the slips to find the boundary as the ensuing fielder is unable to win the chase to the third man rope
allows for the ball to come on to him before dispatching this softly to the leg side
safely negotiates this fuller one just outside off with soft hands
short ball outside off and cut away hard to point, but can't find the gap to get the boundary. Missed out on one there
tests him out with a bouncer on middle and leg which Mahela is late on as he goes for the pull
bangs one in short which Mahela is able to get away behind square on the leg side
defended away off the back foot towards the cover region by Mathews
another short delivery which is handled efficiently by Mathews
another short one which is defended by Mathews off the back foot
pinches a run with a drop single just outside off, executed to perfection with soft hands
this time tries to steer one through midwicket
nicely defended on the front foot by the batsman
turned away to the leg side for a single
played with soft hands towards point as they run another quick single
floated on middle as this is defended back to the bowler
onto the back foot as this is turned away to midwicket for one
nicely on top of this shorter one on middle and leg as they pinch another single
delivers a bumper in the same channel which has Mahela ducking out of the way
eased away in front of square on the leg side
delivered high on the pads as this is glanced fine to deep fine leg
full this time from Mitchell as this is steered to the leg side
drives the final ball of the over on the up through long off
darts in a quicker one on leg which is clipped away to the leg side
drawn forward before tucking this away through backward square for one
able to force a single through the off side
defended off the back foot towards the bowler, who comes round to his left to receive it

and Sri Lanka commit yet another blunder between the wickets, with Mathews paying the price. There was a run on there with this tuck away to midwicket, but Mathews, who was guilty of ball-watching, ends up going halfway down before being sent back by his partner, and is woefully short of his ground as he tries in a desperate effort to make it in. Makes it four down now as New Zealand will accept that wicket with glee
leans nicely forward into a front foot defense as the ball rolls to the off side
onto the back foot as this is eased away off the pads behind square
fuller one on the pads which is steered to mid on, with Thirimanne beating the throw at his end
fended away off the back foot by Mahela to the off side
uses the round-of-wicket angle to get this away behind square on the leg side
hits a fuller length just outside off as Thirimanne is able to get his body behind it
onto the front foot as this is guided to mid off to end the over
played away with soft hands to the leg side for an easy single
this time onto the back foot as this is turned to the leg side
once again on the front foot to the bowler
looks for the gap through point with a cut as Thirimanne hands over the strike
offers room outside off to cut as Mahela duly obliges
flighted on middle and leg as Thirimanne brings the bat down
length ball, just outside off and slanting across the batsman, as this is bunted away
looked to stand in his ground and hammer this through cover, but ends up slicing a thick edge through the slip region, but is stopped before the boundary
back of a length delivery angling in on off and middle. Thirimanne gets right behind the line and blocks it back to the bowler
once again pushed back to the bowler by Thirimanne as he gets onto the front foot
manages to eke out a single to the leg side with a well-placed shot
slants in a back of a length ball outside off as Mahela gets behind the line
turned away to the leg side for none
this time played away to the off side with soft hands
gets deep into the crease before whisking this away off the back foot through the leg side
guides this fuller one pitched outside off to the man at long on
hangs on the back foot before turning this away in the direction of square leg
ends with a floated delivery on middle which is met with a dead, straight bat
cuts away this back of a length outside his off stump towards deep backward point
punches at this back of a length going across him to the off side
shorter one on middle which is mistimed behind square on the leg side with an attempted pull
defended with a nice, straight bat to the off side
wider this time outside off as Thirimanne fails to get this away square off the wicket through point
has a push at this fuller length swinging into the pads as the ball bobbles in the air, but falls just before silly mid off who was placed there for that reason
engineers a couple of runs through deep midwicket with a forceful shot off the back foot through the air
this time bunted away to the leg side
Thirimanne able to fend this one away outside off

slips in a slider which Thirimanne is all over as he gets down on one knee before swiveling in the process as he hit this high over deep midwicket for the first six of the innings. Completely against the run of play that
manages to negotiate this one pitched outside off
efficiently handles this final ball to see the over out
delivers a length ball on middle and leg which is defended back to the bowler
full delivery on and about off which is eased through midwicket for a single. Has moved to 45 off 55 without causing a stir. Class batting this
honing on the pads as this is clipped to backward square
gets this one to nip away from back of a length outside off as Mahela follows it dangerously
tests him out with a slower ball bowled in the same channel as Mahela leaves this one alone
yorker on middle which is eased through midwicket for one by Mahela
fires in a quicker one on middle and leg which is defended back to the bowler
chips this one through long on this time for the single
floated on middle and off as this is blocked back to Nathan
flighted on middle and leg as Thirimanne fails to collect a single through the leg side
this time finds said single with a forceful shot through the leg side
steps out before clubbing this one away through square leg for a single and to keep the strike
has a waft at this length ball pushed across him by the left-hander
full from Anderson as this is defended to the left of the bowler

brings up his half-century in uncharacteristic fashion as this bouncer is ramped over the slips by the ever-ready Mahela, who has to almost grope at this as the ball traveled over and behind to the rope. That was pure hand-eye from Mahela. This is his 77th in ODIs
good length delivery outside off, Jayawardene pushes it to the off side
cut away hard to the man at point, who stops it in its tracks
width on offer as Mahela manages to eke this one through backward point for a couple
defends this quicker one darted in from outside leg and into him
makes a solid connection as he waits on this before lifting it high over cow corner for six. Looks to be switching gears here
safely negotiated by the experienced right-hander
steered straight and with intent at the fielder on the leg side
tries another quicker one which is guided by Mahela to mid on for one
onto the back foot as this is fended away with soft hands to end a decent ten-over spell from Nathan McCullum
139 kph, booming inswinger outside off and curling in as Mahela lets it through

139 kph, and the move looks to have come off beautifully for Brendon as Boult nearly gets the breakthrough, getting Mahela to edge at one which falls low and away to the left of second slip, who is unable to grasp it
good length delivery just outside off. Jayawardene defends it off the front foot to cover
139 kph, almost yorker length on off which is dug out in the direction of mid on
136 kph, this time slips it down the leg side as Mahela has a slightly uppish glance at this, with the ball continuing on down to the fine leg boundary for four
138 kph, ends the over with a lovely length delivery outside off which tails in a touch
141 kph, fuller one outside off as Thirimanne elects to leave
142 kph, pushes through a fuller one which Thirimanne fails to make a solid connection with as he finds the close-in fielder on the off side
141 kph, driven firmly by Thirimanne to the man at long off
worked away off the back foot towards the point region
once again on the front foot as this is bunted away to the off side
able to get a quick single through the leg side as he plays this at the top of the bounce with soft hands
and straight away almost manages to snag a wicket as Boult induces an edge from Thirimanne, with the ball dying as it flew to the slip
fuller length this time, on and about off, as this is fended away by the batsman
139 kph, looking to work this one through the point region, but finds the fielder
gets away a streaky shot through gully as the open space makes it a safe option. Went for the intentional slice which flew quickly to the third man boundary to get Thirimanne some much-needed runs
slips on in back on middle and leg as this is defended with a nice, high elbow
cut away with the intent of getting this past backward point, but can't beat the fielder
143 kph, as easy as you like as Mahela lifts Milne high over long off for a boundary as this one sailed effortlessly before landing with a couple of bounces to the rope
146 kph, hones in on the pads now as this is eased to midwicket
fuller length which is driven with the full face towards the region of long on
manages to get this fuller one away through midwicket for a couple
143 kph, in the slot as Thirimamne leans into a sumptuous drive through the covers, but doesn't quite get enough on it for it to reach the boundary, as sweeper cover comes round to cut it off
142 kph, rocks onto the back foot as this is defended to the leg side
135 kph, clipped away on the front foot through midwicket for a couple
135 kph, able to run this fuller one through the third man region
136 kph, driven firmly on the up square off the wicket, but finds the fielder
120 kph, slower ball outside his off stump which is punched away through point
139 kph, is well late on this short of a length outside his off stump
137 kph, shortish delivery outside off which is fended to the off side by Thirmanne
146 kph, tries to drive on the up square off the wicket, but finds the fielder
147 kph, fuller one which Jayawardene has a pop at as he lifts this towards mid off, but Brendon, who is a bit deep, is unable to get his hands under it to take the chance
144 kph, guided this time by Mahela towards Baz, who moseys over to collect
145 kph, shows his precision with a lofted drive on the up through the covers which finds the gap and gets the result he sought
145 kph, this time straying on the pads as this is flicked away to deep midwicket

144 kph, gets this one to pitch outside leg before turning into Lahiru, who is late on it as he brings the bat down. Milne goes for the appeal, but is turned out by the umpire. NZ opt not to go for the review
in the slot as Mahela drives this one crisply to deep extra-cover

and it is that man Williamson who strikes again as Thirimanne, looking to break the shackles somewhat, slices at this length ball outside his off stump, with the intent of getting this past backward point, but instead he manages to locate the man, who doesn't put it down. Five wickets down now are Sri Lanka, and they still need some runs in order to put pressure on the hosts
starts off with a nice full delivery on middle which is safely negotiated
elects to leave this length ball outside his off stump
punched away off the back foot towards the covers
fuller length outside off which is left well alone by the batsman
tries to blitz this full delivery past Anderson, but ends up finding the bowler
in the slot for Mahela as this is driven firmly to extra-cover
elects to leave this just back of a length ball outside his off stump
finds the gap through the covers off the back foot to pinch a couple
removes all limbs from the equation as this one continues through to the keeper
short and some width on offer as Jeevan reaches out to it to guide it just behind square on the off side
turned away to the leg side by Mendis
tucks away a single towards the leg side, with the fielder, who is left-handed, picking it up in one smooth motion and throwing in a chance at the striker's end, missing by not too far
manages to eke out a single down to third man
gets some appreciable shape away as the ball is delivered wide of off stump
good surprise bouncer from Mitchell which has Jeevan trying to avoid it rather awkwardly
gets on top of this fuller one as he looks to guide it past mid on
eased away on the front foot behind square for a single down the leg side
too full and on the pads as Mendis does well to angle this away through the vacant midwicket region for a boundary
this time chopped away through the covers as the pair are able to scamper a quick single. Good backing up from Nathan who dives to his right to save this errant throw from Boult at the non-striker's
overpitched from Anderson and Mahela just lifts him effortlessly over long off for a one-bounce four
tries out the slower ball, outside Mahela's off stump, as he thinks about having a go before letting it through to the keeper
fuller one which is pushed across and coming in as this is played to the off side by the batsman for a single
120 kph, slower ball which goes across the batsman as this is guided straight to mid off
opens the face to run this one past second slip to third man

135 kph, manages to induce an edge to this one shaping away a touch from outside off, with Jeevan looking to work this down the leg side before offering up a chance at slip, which doesn't fall to hand
138 kph, this time tailing into the batsman from a similar length as this is defended away
138 kph, turned away off the back foot towards mid on
139 kph, eased away off the back foot through the leg side for one
and this time Mahela offers an edge as this one flies well short of the slipper
cramped for room as he looked to run this down to third man
advances down the track before heaving Anderson high over cow corner for a huge six. Wonderful strike that from Jeevan
pushes at this length ball outside his off stump and coming in as the ball hangs temporarily in the leg side
excellent use of the feet, this time from Mahela, as he shimmies down before lifting Anderson over extra-cover for a well-timed blow. Takes him to 97 as well
this time works it away off the back foot behind square for a single
short of a length ball which is defended with soft hands to the off side as Mahela hares to the other end. Takes him to 99
Jeevan holes out in the deep as he fails to get on top of this shorter delivery from Mitchell, with the ball splicing high over to long off, with Brendon getting under it comfortably
this time able to squirt it away through backward point to bring back Mahela on strike, who is on 99

cuts, and cuts hard through backward point to bring up his 18th ODI hundred. A tremendous one this as it came in trying circumstances, and when his team needed the most. A characteristic Mahela ton, and hopefully he can keep it going a little bit more
goes slightly aerial over the off side with a poke towards the covers
given enough room to slice this high over the slips to find the third man boundary, despite the man running in from the right
delivers a bumper which the batsman avoids at all costs
caught by Brendon McCullum!! Mendis is gone! It was short and wide outside off, Mendis swings hard at it, gets a top edge and McCullum at mid off takes an easy catch
delivers a bouncer first up to Mahela, who is unable to get under it sufficiently

and Mahela's fine innings comes to an end as he holes out high over backward square to Corey Anderson, who puts in a dive at the end to hold on to the chance in the deep. Mahela was looking to pull this shorter one high over cow corner, but instead miscued it behind to Anderson, who was stationed around backward square. Sublime ODI innings this from Mahela. Could it be enough though ?

and Mitchell has suddenly made it three wickets in the over as Perera goes out in the softest manner possible, offering up a thick outside edge which carried comfortably to Ronchi, who took it without incident. Mitchell now on a hat-trick
bowls a lovely length delivery just outside off which is met with a correct, front foot defence
cut away quickly to the man at point, who does well to stop it
this time guided away on the front foot towards extra-cover

width outside off which is dealt with accordingly, but the return throw ends up being fired in wild, affording the extra run as the fielder as to overrun towards the direction of cow corner to pick it up
stands nice and tall as he defends away to the leg side
pushes through a fuller one which nibbles away a touch as Senanayake followed through with a false stroke
this time straying on the hips as Senanayake is well late on it
chases after this short and wide delivery with a lofted cut over backward point, but is stopped just before the boundary
cramps him for room as he looks to run this through the slips, but is not quite in control of the shot
manages to get away a boundary down to deep fine leg as Mitchell gets the line wrong

short of a length on middle which catches the splice of Senanyake's bat as the ball bobbles high. Mitchell went after it in his follow through, but then he realises he is falling short of it as the ball lands harmlessly
another shortish length delivery which is dealt with accordingly by the batsman
has a flash at this short and wide delivery, with this being ramped over to deep backward point
ends up splicing this back of a length going across him to backward point
this time looking for the big heave through long on, but instead offers a thick outside edge which is taken cleanly by Ronchi. Sri Lanka nine down now, and New Zealand one away from bowling them out
length going across him as Eranga thinks momentarily about clubbing this back over the bowler
opens the face to this short of a length as he edge this past the slip, who puts in a desperate dive, as the ball continues on towards third man
uses his feet this time as he backs away to clear the straight boundary, but is late on the ball
and the innings finishes off with a yorker, just off the mark as it was looking to hit off, as Eranga manages to eke out a single through cover to get Sri Lanka to 218 for 9

inn2.comm: 129 kph, gets some swing into the batsman straight away as Guptill rocks forward to defend
127 kph, elects to leave this one wobbling outside his off stump to the keeper

130 kph, and Kula strikes in the first over as he gets Guptill to go after a length ball outside off, looking to slice this past point, but instead hits it straight to the fielder, who takes it comfortably. It was Dilshan too, so that was always a risky stroke

130 kph, shuffles across to this fuller one shaping in as this strikes just under the knee roll as he looked to clip this down the leg side. Looks like this one was going down leg on second view, so it is a good thing they didn't opt for the review. Ends up being signalled four leg byes
129 kph, big, hooping swing into the batsman as Williamson helps it along to the leg side
130 kph, able to lean into a drive which finds the man at mid off
131 kph, back of a length ball straying on the pads as Brendon just about manages to get it away to the leg side
132 kph, full delivery which shapes away as Brendon gets away with a streaky slice over cover for a boundary. Not really in control, but achieves the desired result
135 kph, this time targets the pads as Brendon is able to whip it behind to backward square

134 kph, advances down the track as he looks for the slice over cover again, but this time ends up letting go off the handle as he went for the slice, with the bat coming off his gloves and falling just behind square on the leg side
133 kph, short from Eranga and on the hips as Brendon is onto it in a flash, glancing this behind to the deep fine leg boundary
135 kph, Brendon is showing Eranga who's boss as he this time gets away the fast bowler squarer off the wicket on the leg side, beating the chasing fielder from fine leg to the boundary
128 kph, watched carefully outside his off stump as this nibbles in a touch as it travels through to the keeper
129 kph, gets pronounced swing into the batsman as Williamson remains rigid in defence
130 kph, in the same channel, except this time the inswing is not so pronounced, with Williamson running this towards gully for one. Brings back the Bazinator on strike
129 kph, angling in from outside off as Brendon tucks this away to the leg side
129 kph, cracking shot off the back foot as Kula offers width which Brendon takes with glee, freeing his arms to powerfully cut this away to the boundary

129 kph, shimmies down the track to this length ball before carving Kula high over backward point for a flat six which travels at a rate of knots. This is one of his trademark shots as he finishes with typical McCullum flourish
153 kph? This can't be right! No way! Probably meant 135 kph. Anyways, ends up being defended back to the bowler
137 kph, that's more like it. This time pitched on a length on off as this is fended away to the off side
136 kph, content to let this one outside his off stump through to the keeper

134 kph, had to rub my eyes to make sure that wasn't Brendon as this time it is Kane's turn to have some fun at the Hagley. Wide delivery outside off which is given the treatment as Kane cuts this in front of square to the boundary
137 kph, this time slips it down the leg side as Williamson flicks this behind to backward square

134 kph, Brendon on strike, which means yet another strike towards the boundary as he ramps this short of a length through the gully region, with the fielder at sweeper cover coming round to try and cut it off. Replays are checking if any part of his body was dragged over the rope in the attempt. Ends up just being restricted to three thanks to the fine effort at the rope
has a look at Senanayake for about half a second before clobbering this flighted ball on middle high over long off for a huge six. Brendon is in T20 mode at the moment
this time looked for the big sweep round the corner, but is late on it
slows down his action a touch as he delivers this round the wicket to Brendon. Ends up being defended by the batsman
slipped in from outside leg as Brendon is able to eke out a single through the leg side to get Kane on strike
ends up gloving this one which bounces a bit more than expected, but the ball lands harmlessly to the off side
gropes at this fuller length ball pitched on middle as Kane manages to pickup two with a clip through midwicket
starts with a wide, gentle loosener which is sent through backward point in no time as Brendon finds yet another boundary. He is on a tear is Baz
short again and this time Brendon goes for the ramp high over third man to find another useful boundary. He is just batting on his own terms here is Baz
and Mathews finally gets a dot as this length ball on and around off is defended back to the bowler
length ball nipping into Brendon as he just about manages to run this away through the vacant slip region for a single
length ball, which gets a hint of away movement, as this is blunted to the off side by Williamson
a little bit of away swing on display for Mathews as this is defended with a nice, straight bat
advances down the track and then bludgeons Senanyake high over cow corner to tie the record for his fastest ODI fifty. This one coming off just 19 balls. What a blazing innings already!
looks to back away to create room through the off side but is late on it
defended by the master of disaster as he looks for the right ball to go after

and Senanayake manages to have the final laugh as he invites Brendon to come down with another tossed up delivery which Brendon swings down the wrong line, looking to clear cow corner once more. Sangakkara does well to collect the take and remove the bails before Brendon could react. What a way to to get this second innings cracking!
flights one outside Latham's off stump as this is defended away carefully
reaches out to this final ball to see out a successful over for New Zealand
gets behind the line of the ball at the stumps to keep it out
turned away through midwicket, hits the gap for a couple
pushes towards mid-off, spots a single and collects it easily
teases him in the off-stump corridor, doesn't bite
stays back and slices to deep point
length ball a shade outside off, tucked to midwicket
tossed up outside off, defended calmly
lovely line from Sachithra as the tosses it up slower and targets middle, defended
gets forward to defend a good length ball outside off
judged the length early and went back to tickle the flatter ball behind square leg
prefers to stay back to a flighted ball on off stump, uses the extra time he gives himself to flick through square leg
steps to the pitch of a flighted offspinner and defends safely
back of a length on off stump, Williamson works it away off his hips through midwicket
fuller delivery a shade outside off, pushed to mid-off
back of a length in the channel, Latham's defensive bat is good enough
opens the face to run the shortish ball outside off to the right of point, and Dilshan is agile in that region
takes it on the up and crunches a drive through cover. Relied on timing alone and benefits from that
good length ball outside off, left alone to the keeper

pitched just outside off as Mahela takes an absolute pearl from outside off to this thick outside edge as Kane looked surprised by the extra bounce. Mahela sticks out the left hand and then manages to just hold onto the chance as Kane looks back in utter disbelief. Really was an incredible reflex catch, and that too his weak side. Big wicket for Sri Lanka as they look to gain control of this run rate and keep the hosts in check
flights one on middle and off which Elliot is a touch late on as the ball strikes the front pad
looks to chip this one through midwicket, but thankfully doesn't hit it as well as he would have liked as the ball falls just short of the man at silly mid on

this time Senanayake manages to get him to chip it just that much further to the fielder, who takes it before it falls to ground. Elliot is not going anywhere though at the moment as he wants the review. Replays show that the front foot is okay. This once may have gone to ground though as it is hard to see whether there are fingers under the ball. This is going to be touch and go... Big decision here too as this has been given not out
gets forward before playing this with soft hands to the leg side
darted in on leg as Latham sweeps this one round the corner to pickup a single

123 kph, Elliott plays all around this length ball pitching outside off and swinging in quite a bit, beating the chop from Elliott who didn't expect the ball to shape in so much. Suddenly Sri Lanka look quite dangerous here as they have reduced New Zealand to 77 for 4
125 kph, this time swing away from the left-hander as Anderson opts to let it go through
123 kph, slip and gully in place as this one just nibbles away from a back of a length outside off
125 kph, gets the bat out of the way to this fuller length ball which shapes away
123 kph, length on middle and leg which is tucked away to midwicket by the batsman
122 kph, ends with an outswinger to the left-hander which is left well alone
flighted on middle as this is safely negotiated by Anderson
gives this plenty of air as Anderson hangs on the back foot to defend
rocks forward to defend this flighted ball from Senanayake
shuffles over to the off stump to work this through long on for one
reaches out to defend this one pitched on and about off. That was the carrom ball from the spinner

flighted on middle and leg as Latham is quickly into position to sweep this authoritatively to the square leg boundary. Despite the dive by the fielder before the rope, he is unable to take the pace off the ball as it kicked off the turf and ricocheted back to the rope
124 kph, fuller length ball pushed across the batsman as Anderson is a touch late on the drive

123 kph, just stand and deliver from Anderson as he clubs this one back over long off, not quite getting the timing on it, but hitting it well enough for the pair to run three. Was stopped before the boundary, and replays show that this indeed will be just the three runs
123 kph, length ball jagging away from outside off as Latham follows it to find the man at point
124 kph, fuller length delivery honing in on middle and off as this is defended back to the bowler
122 kph, defended by Latham as he looks to keep things steady for the side
125 kph, works away this back of a length going across him to the fielder at point to end the over
provides plenty of flight outside off as this is swept hard to the man at deep square leg
eased down to long on for a straightforward single
gives this one plenty of air as Latham employs his trusty sweep to find the fielder at deep fine leg
worked away off the back foot to mid on
backs away before chopping this one back towards the bowler
gives it plenty of rip as this is tucked away neatly to mid on
123 kph, meets this length ball going across him with the full face of the bat
124 kph, steers this past the cover fielder to find sweeper cover
123 kph, gets dangerously close to offering up a thick outside edge to Sangakkara as he follows this short of a length going away from him
122 kph, no one in the deep on the off side as Anderson plants his foot to carve Kula uppishly through cover to find the boundary
123 kph, sensibly allows this fuller length delivery bowled closer to the body to go through to the keeper
124 kph, defended with a nice, straight bat to end the over
defends this first one from round the wicket to the off side
shifts his weight onto the back foot before punching this through the covers
gives this one some air as Anderson leans forward to steer this to the leg side
rocks onto the back foot before playing this one back to the bowler
once again on the back foot as this is played away with soft hands
advances down a touch before easing this down to long on for a single
unable to get away this short of a length outside his off stump, with Anderson way too early into the shot as he looked to blast through the covers

defended away off the back foot by Anderson as Perera's white towel, which he keeps behind his back, ends up falling away and then getting kicked up in the followthrough. Must have distracted Anderson there surely?
tucks away this length ball on the hips to the leg side
solidly behind the line of this length ball on middle and leg
defended to the right of the bowler as this is delivered on a back of a length just outside off
looks to steer this one past the man at point, but fails to do so
darts in one on and about off as Anderson goes for the sweep down fine leg. Sangakkara is convinced this hit the pad first as he goes for a loud appeal. Replays show this indeed came off the bat
works with the angle once more as they help themselves to a single through backward square

invites him to have a drive at this flighted delivery outside off which spins away sharply as Latham looked to drive this between long off and cover. Ends up being late on it as he plays the wrong line to give Sangakkara his second stumping victim of the day
and Ronchi almost gives it away first ball as he chips this one in the air through midwicket, with the ball luckily away from any fielders
gets nice and low to defend Dilshan to the leg side
clears the front foot to attack this leg-stump line from Dilshan, sweeping at this firmly, but finding backward square

manages to induce an edge with a just back of a length ball on and around off which Corey is late on as he gets into his downswing. This one, however, died quickly on the slipper, who is unable to field it as the ball rushes through to the boundary. Useful runs that for NZ
hangs on the back foot before fending this away to the leg side
reaches out to poke this length ball outside off away to the point fielder
gets solidly behind the line of this short of a length on middle and off
glanced away off the hips to deep fine leg for one
short and width on offer as Ronchi finds a crucial boundary over backward point to get four. Waited before getting under it to find the rope
Dilshan is greeted to the crease with a powerful sweep square off the wicket which beats the chasing deep fine leg fielder to the boundary, despite putting in the dive
waits and waits before backing away to cut this through point for a single
on the back foot as this is blunted away towards mid on
gives this one some air as Ronchi defends off the back foot
looks to get on the back foot once more as this is turned back to the bowler
this time pierces the gap through backward square as he maneuvers himself into position to sweep. Ends up being cut off before the third man boundary by the fielder
slaps this length ball going across him hard to the man at mid off
straying on the pads as Anderson picks his spot before dispatching this with a mighty flick through midwicket for four. Just raced away across the outfield
this time elects to leave the back of a length ball going across him
onto the front foot as this is defended carefully to the bowler
good leave from Anderson as the extra bounce means the ball goes safely over the stumps to the keeper, with this one pitching on and about off
straight from Perera as this is drilled back in the same direction, with Mathews coming down from long on to field the ball before the rope
plays a rather awkward-looking paddle-sweep, with the ball finding its way to midwicket, before the return throw hits the non-striker's stumps, allowing for an extra run to be taken
waits on the front foot before defending this away with soft hands
short from the bowler as Anderson gets this away with a meaty hit to deep square leg
this time eased off the pads to deep midwicket
doesn't quite time this as he looks to go over cow corner, but instead hits it towards the fielder stationed there with a mistimed heave
uppishly flicked away off the back foot to deep midwicket for a single
back of a length delivery which is helped away off the pads to deep fine leg for one
ends up being late on this pull through midwicket as the ball rolls feebly to the leg side
tries to work away a single through long on, but is stopped by the mid on fielder instead
gets into position to drive this through the covers as the pair scamper a couple
shifts his weight onto the back foot as this is fended away to the leg side
solidly behind the line of this back of a length delivery on off stump
waits on the back foot before pinching a single through midwicket
on the front foot as this is carefully played away to the leg side
powerfully swept through to deep square leg as this gets to him in no time
gives this some air as Anderson is forward to defend
sweeps this with authority in front of square as the fielder at cow corner is able to stop it before it hit the rope
pushed off the back foot in the general vicinity of mid on as they debate over the single, but then decide against it
driven firmly on the front foot to the man at long off
this time blunted away to the fielder at cover

overpitched from Angelo as Corey's eyes light up at this half-volley in the slot, which Anderson obliges with a meaty drive through the covers which none of the fielders have a hope of getting close to as it races to the extra-cover boundary
looks for the forcing shot through the covers, but is slightly late as he gets into his downswing

short from Angelo, and at his military medium pace, too easy as well as Anderson latches onto this in a flash, middling this one with a solid pull that just took off across the outfield to find the rope at midwicket
sensibly allows this length ball pushed across him to travel through to Sangakkara
133 kph, begins with a gentle loosener down the leg side which is clipped uppishly through to backward square
131 kph, just clatters this length ball outside off to sweeper cover, but finds the fielder right away as he looked to penetrate the gap
137 kph, too full and on the pads as this is flicked for an easy single

135 kph, Ronchi ends up offering a leading edge chance to this ball going down the leg side, as the ball catches the edge to bobble high over mid off, who backs away before taking the catch safely. Vital breakthrough for Sri Lanka as New Zealand have just four wickets in hand now, with 70 still required to get. Should even out the game a touch more now with that scalp
136 kph, targets the pads of Anderson as this is helped away to deep square leg for one
141 kph, almost gives an edge away to Sangakkara as he follows after this fuller length ball which just nibbles away a touch as it travels through to the keeper
waits on the front foot before bunting this one away with soft hands
drives this one off the back foot towards mid off, but finds the fielder quicker than he would have liked
plays a lovely drive off the back foot through the covers
gets an inside-edge to this ball on middle and leg, with Perera letting rip a vociferous appeal, but to no avail
allows this one to sail through outside off to the keeper
width outside off which Nathan cannot be enticed to go after. Was looking for the wide but that one was definitely within the margin
136 kph, squeezes away the fast bowler through backward point for one
137 kph, gets this to nibble in a touch as Nathan follows dangerously close with a straight bat
135 kph, onto the pads as this is clipped away to deep square leg
135 kph, great fielding by Thirimanne at mid off as he cuts off Anderson, who was looking for the crunching drive through the covers
136 kph, defended away to the off side by the left-handed batsman

135 kph, couldn't have made a sweeter connection with the bat as this one just flies high over midwicket with a powerful pull shot by Anderson. Brute strength from the allrounder as there is a superb catch in the crowd, with the man taking it with just one hand before falling back after impact. Brings up his fifty as well with that meaty blow
nicely defended off the back foot by the batsman
solid punch off the back foot to the man at cover
just back of a length, outside off, as McCullum defends inside the line of it
eased away off the back foot towards extra-cover as the fielder swoops onto it
tries to force this away through backward point off the back foot, but to no avail
full and on the pads as this is flicked effortlessly by Anderson, who places this one beautifully to find the boundary at cow corner
attacking the leg stump from round the wicket as Nathan tries to sweep this round the corner
ends up working with the angle round the wicket to get the sweep away
gives this one plenty of rip as Anderson leans into a drive towards mid off
a touch late as he looks for the sweep down to square leg
employs the sweep to good effect to pinch a single down the leg side
slow in the air as this one arrived to Anderson, who is also late as he defends with soft hands to the off side
138 kph, a lot better from McCullum as the width of this delivery allowed for him to use his hands and cut this away fiercely to the square boundary for four
137 kph, this time defended with a nice, straight bat
133 kph, short and well wide outside off as this is signaled by the umpire
132 kph, tucked away off the pads towards backward square
131 kph, gets good carry off the deck as this one leaps away from a back of a length, with Anderson doing well to weave out of its path
133 kph, turned away off the hips towards the leg side as they steal the single
132 kph, rocks onto the front foot before playing this away to the cover fielder
slaps this pitched up delivery from Senanayake straight to mid off
on the back foot as he waits before turning this away towards square leg to scamper a quick single
gives this plenty of air as Nathan fails to get this through the gap at extra-cover, finding long off instead
surprises Nathan with the bounce outside leg as this is turned away with soft hands
flighted just outside off as Anderson sweeps this powerfully to midwicket, with the fielder just about able to get to it in the deep
this time operating on a leg-stump line as Nathan works this fine
starts off with a nice, flighted delivery outside off which is driven firmly to long off
driven straight back to the bowler who stops it in its followthrough
safely negotiates this fuller length ball on off as this is squirted away to the off side

backs away before the spin of the ball away from the bat meant Anderson provided an outside edge which went past the slip to the third man boundary. Was looking to create room to force this away through the covers
this one stays low outside off as Anderson employs the cut once more
on the back foot and defended by the batsman to the bowler
flashes hard at this short of a length outside his off stump, but is late on it
squares up Nathan with a length ball outside his off stump as the ball is squirted away in that direction
driven firmly by Nathan on the front foot as Lahiru leaps in from silly mid off to cut off a certain boundary
manages to slice away this back of a length delivery to the fielder at third man
length delivery going across the batsman as it is allowed to carry through to the keeper
short and wide and given the proper treatment as this is hammered across extra-cover for a blazing boundary
126 kph, gets this to swing in appreciably from a length outside off, with the ball striking the top of his left pad
124 kph, run away through the gully region for a single down to third man
123 kph, tests him out with a short one which Anderson is late on. Doesn't matter though as it is signaled wide by the umpire
123 kph, once again tries the bouncer as Anderson goes after it, but is late once more
123 kph, looking for the wide yorker as Anderson is able to reach and slice this behind to third man
125 kph, targeting the hips now as they pick off a single through backward square
123 kph, ends the over with a back of a length delivery which goes across Anderson
tossed up on leg as this is eased down to long on
defended with an angled bat as the ball rolls harmlessly to the leg side
tossed up on middle as this is struck back to the bowler
slipping down the leg side now as Anderson just about manages to get bat on it, with the ball continuing on slowly to beat the chasing fielder to the fine leg boundary
outrageous shot from Anderson! This one was taken from outside off and swept straight through long on for a powerful boundary. He just smashed that so hard that there really was no chance
allows this one to spin outside his off stump to end the over
122 kph, punched away off the back foot towards the cover fielder. Reaches 1000 ODI runs as well in the process
122 kph, allows this one to carry through to the keeper from outside off
fuller length delivery on off and middle. Anderson comes forward and flicks it to midwicket for a single
122 kph, defended away with soft hands to the leg side
125 kph, pushes this length delivery outside off towards the cover region
125 kph, hooks this shorter one over deep backward square to retain strike
nicely negotiated as the ball drifts to the off side

another beautiful, flighted delivery, which drifts as Nathan plays inside of the line. Sangakkara collects as the ball rushes past and whips off the bails. They appeal for the stumping chance, and the umpires are not sure as they look to have a review. Replays show that while he was indeed on the line initially, the point when the bail has come off shows he just might be in, but only by a whisker. Ends up being ruled not out
turned away off the pads towards the direction of backward square
looks to help this one go fine down the leg side, and Nathan is able to pull off the single after the bobble by the fielder at backward square
on the back foot as this is played softly to the off side
decides to leave this final ball from Senanayake to end a good spell from the spinner
122 kph, this one straying on the pads as he looks to help this down the leg side for a quick single
123 kph, punches this one off the back foot towards the covers
123 kph, utilises the angle of this ball coming in to work this through midwicket for one
124 kph, too full and on the pads as this is flicked to deep midwicket
124 kph, is woefully late on this inswinger from Kula as he ends up inside-edging onto his pads
124 kph, full, outside off, which is squirted away through point for a couple
defended with soft hands to the off side

Dilshan removes the danger man as Anderson is late on the sweep, with the ball striking in line with the stumps on a fuller length. Looked good as gone there. Anderson, realising the match situation, wants the review. Replays show that this indeed was as plumb as it looked the first time. Ends up being confirmed as out as Anderson walks off to good applause as he trudges off with a score of 81
negotiates this first ball to the off side with soft hands
reaches forward before fending away the ball to the off side
on the front foot to Dilshan as this is turned away to the leg side

plays with the softest of hands near the body as he sets off for the quick single to the other end. The non-striker is just about able to put in the dive after point swoops in to have a throw, with Sangakkara collecting it before removing the bails. A direct hit would definitely have made things interesting there as he looked to be short of his ground. They go upstairs to confirm, and it is indeed not out
133 kph, defended off the back foot to the off side
138 kph, looks for the drop single outside off but hits it a bit too well to the cover fielder
129 kph, shorter one outside off which Milne is late on as he looks for the ramp over the slips
132 kph, solidly behind the line of this fuller length ball on middle and leg

135 kph, and nine becomes five as Milne literally halves the required chase with a clip through midwicket to find the boundary. This one raced away off the bat. Huge sigh of relief across the ground after that stroke

134 kph, almost gets another boundary, this time a streaky one off an edge through the slips, but is cut off by third man who puts in a valiant dive. Nathan wanted a second, but sends back Milne after he sees the powerful throw from the deep
once again manages to get it through midwicket, but is only kept to one. NZ just a boundary away now
tries out a leg-side delivery which is neatly swept round the corner to deep fine leg for a couple. Scores are now level as well
defended from the crease off the back foot as some boos ring in from the crowd
happy to wait on the back foot as this carrom ball is slipped in from Dilshan on middle and off
looked for the forcing shot through long on, but finds the bowler
and Nathan manages to prise out the winning single through midwicket to ensure a satisfying three-wicket victory for the hosts to take first blood in this seven-match series
